title: 'He helped save my mom today': Gentle ginger feline saves woman's life after she passes out by biting her and keeping her conscious until the ETMs arrived
description: We don't know how it's possible, but some people still actually believe that cats don't care about their humans - that they only tolerate us because we feed them. These people must have never had cats in their lives. Because cats care about their humans so, so much. That is something undeniable that you learn incredibly fast as a cat owner. And sure, some cats have funny ways of showing affection, but that doesn't make their affection any less real. It just means that you have to pay attention to their love languages a little more closely. And all cats have one thing in common - cats will be there for you when you need them the most. They can tell when something is wrong with you. They know when you actually need their help - emotional, or like the cat today - physical. The cat in this story knew that something was wrong with one of his humans, and whether he knew what he was doing or not, keeping this woman conscious until the EMTs arrived to help her most likely has saved her life.
author: Mariel Ruvinsky
excerpt: 'He helped save my mom today': Gentle ginger feline saves woman's life after she passes out by biting her and keeping her conscious until the ETMs arrived - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: Everyone can talk about how aloof cats are all day long, but we, as cat owners, we know that when we truly need them, they are there for us. And they always will be. This story is just a little tiny piece of proof. He knew something was wrong, and he knew he needed to help somehow.  We wish both your mom and your cat a very long and healthy life. And you too. This is a story full of good creatures, and we hope that writing about it has brought our readers as much hope and joy as it has brought into our lives.
html:
Everyone can talk about how aloof cats are all day long, but we, as cat owners, we know that when we truly need them, they are there for us. And they always will be. This story is just a little tiny piece of proof. He knew something was wrong, and he knew he needed to help somehow. 

We wish both your mom and your cat a very long and healthy life. And you too. This is a story full of good creatures, and we hope that writing about it has brought our readers as much hope and joy as it has brought into our lives.
